TopicTitle: [SOLVED] Detecting "... was damaged by engine exhaust ..." events

Articles.Content:
How can I add a hook that will respond to the log events warning of engine exhaust?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-17T22:55:05Z" title="03/17/2015 10:55  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 17, 2015</time> by Coffeeman**

Don't think there's an even, I think that would be ModuleEngines notifying when it's exhaust collides. Could be wrong, but unless there's something obvious in GameEvents, I think you might have to check yourself.
Actually it trigger an onSplashDamage event, so you would ave to register the event and you will get notifications. Not sure if the event provide the damaged part or the engine part info however

> 
> Actually it trigger an onSplashDamage event, so you would ave to register the event and you will get notifications. Not sure if the event provide the damaged part or the engine part info however

Perfect, thanks!

[onSplashDamage produces an EventReport](http://anatid.github.io/XML-Documentation-for-the-KSP-API/class_game_events.html#af05e7fc168b800539d840b59467a7427); the damaged part's name is given by the "name" string, the string following the originating Part reference.
